thread.title: APNewsBreak: US spec ops knew Afghan site was hospital
thread.title_full: APNewsBreak: US spec ops knew Afghan site was hospital

title: APNewsBreak: US spec ops knew Afghan site was hospital
text: > Top News APNewsBreak: US spec ops knew Afghan site was hospital Christopher Stokes, second left, the general director of Doctors Without Borders stands at the gate of its hospital after U.S. troops left the area in Kunduz, Afghanistan, Thursday, Oct. 15, 2015. Taliban fighters took control of the key northern city late last month, leading to a protracted battle with Afghan forces supported by U.S. airstrikes. During the fighting, a U.S. air attack hit the hospital, killing at least 12 Doctors Without Borders staff and 10 patients. (AP Photo/Najim Rahim)
